Administration.text:
Type: Vitamin
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: IV/IM, oral, nasal, sublingual
Also known as cobalamin, cyanocobalamin

Adult_Dosing.text:
Normal absorption: 1000 mcg/day PO
Malabsorption: 100-1000 mcg IV/IM or deep SC injection daily for 6 or 7 days
Nasal spray: 500 mcg intranasally in one nostril weekly

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: increased dose/frequency may be required
Hepatic dosing: increased dose/frequency may be required

Serious.text:
CHF, pulmonary edema
Anaphylaxis, angioedema
Peripheral vascular disease

Common.text:
Injection site pain
Arthralgia
Dizziness, headache
Nasopharyngitis

Serious.text:
CHF, pulmonary edema

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life:
Metabolism: biliary; enterohepatic cycling
Excretion: mostly renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Vital to cell reproduction, growth, and synthesis of myelin and nucleoprotein, as well as energy metabolism

See_Also.text:
Vitamin B12 deficiency
Folic acid
Vitamin deficiencies
